result.execSummary:
The defendant Khari K Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and assessments.  Any cash bail to apply. Failure to pay shall rsult in a civil judgment.

10-06-2017/ Judge David Hansher                   
The Court orders that the defendant's sentence be modified to 38 months of initial confinement and 46 months of extended supervision.               
All other terms and conditions of the sentence remain the same.                  
********************************************************            


Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after two (2) years.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with David C., Jason K., Kari S. and codefendant Aaron Thomas.

Cooperate with DOC.
Cooperate with treatment and counseing programs as determined by agent.
Cooperate with cognitive intervention programming.
Pay supervision fees as determined by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Attend following program and/or assessment:  AODA.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights ar restored.

Hearing/status conference  8/14/2014 to determine if restitution is an issue.

*****8-25-14 Judge Pocan, Court ordered restitution in the amount of $19975.81, joint and several, owed to Radio Shack and payable as a condition of Extended Supervision. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. Restitutuion to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. before costs and surcharges *******

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Khari K Jones in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  Additional statements by:  Sheila J.  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 7 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 4 YEARS with credit for 6 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 3 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER 2 years.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of all inmate funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the Department of Corrections.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA.
- Cooperate with treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Cooperate with Cognitive Intervention programming.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
- No contact with David C., Jason K., Kari S. and co-defendant Aaron Thomas.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed; copy to defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference to determine if restitiution is an issue.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge POCAN, Branch 26, in ROOM 634 of the COURTHOUSE.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Status conference scheduled for 08-14-2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in court, Attorney Gaertner not in court.  Sentencing rescheduled to JULY 15, 2014, 1:30PM.  kmw
